member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database.EnumLocks
member.summary: Enumerates a list of all current locks held on the database.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of locks held on the database and information about the type and location of the locks. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type DescriptionRequestorSpidThe system process ID value of the process that is holding a lock on a database resource.LockTypeThe description of the type of lock. See the syslockinfo table for a description of different lock types.DatabaseThe name of the database on which the lock is held.TableThe name of the table on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on a table.IndexThe name of the index on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on an index.StatusThe status of the lock, which can be one of the following:1 = Granted.2 = Converting.3 = Waiting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database.EnumLocks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of current locks held on the database for a specified system process ID.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of locks held on the database and information about the type and location of the locks. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionRequestorSpidThe system process ID value of the process that is holding a lock on a database resource.LockTypeThe description of the type of lock. See the syslockinfo table for a description of different lock types.DatabaseThe name of the database on which the lock is held.TableThe name of the table on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on a table.IndexThe name of the index on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on an index.StatusThe status of the lock, which can be one of the following:1 = Granted.2 = Converting.3 = Waiting.
member.param: An that specifies the process ID value that uniquely identifies the process.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions from other users on the database.If True, the grantee is given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions from other users on the database.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions from other users on the database.

A property that specifies whether users, to whom the grantee has granted the specified set of permissions, are also revoked the set of permissions.If True, the grantee and users to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission are all revoked the specified set of permissions on the database.If False, only the grantee is revoked the specified set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database.Revoke(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Revokes previously granted permissions from a grantee on the database and any other users to whom the grantee has granted the specified set of permissions. The grantee is also given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions from other users under an assumed role.
member.param: A object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A value that specifies a grantee to be revoked access to the set of permissions.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions from other users on the database.If True, the grantee is given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions to other users on the database.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to revoke the specified set of permissions to other users on the database.

A property that specifies whether users to whom the grantee has granted the specified set of permissions are also revoked the set of permissions.If True, the grantee and users to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission are all revoked the specified set of permissions on the database.If False, only the grantee is revoked the specified set of permissions.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when that user revokes the specified set of permission from other users on the database. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.returns: A property value that specifies whether the database DDL trigger is enabled.If True, the database DDL trigger is enabled.If False (default), the database DDL trigger is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the Transact-SQL batch or managed code is encrypted.
member.returns: A property value that specifies whether the trigger code is encrypted.If True, the trigger code is encrypted.If False (default), the trigger code is not encrypted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.IsSystemObject
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the database data definition language (DDL) trigger is a system object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the database DDL trigger is a system object.If True, the database DDL trigger is a system object.If False (default), the database DDL trigger is user defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.MethodName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the method that is owned by the class in the assembly, which is executed when the trigger is raised.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the method in the class that is owned by the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.NotForReplication
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the database data definition language (DDL) trigger is available for replication.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the database DDL trigger is available for replication.If True, the database DDL trigger cannot be used by replication services.If False (default), the database DDL trigger is available for replication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that is the parent of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.QuotedIdentifierStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether identifiers delimited by double quotation marks are Transact-SQL reserved keywords or contain characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.
member.returns: A value that specifies how quoted identifiers are handled in the database data definition language (DDL) trigger.If True, quoted identifiers are used to allow characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.If False (default), quoted identifiers are used to specify Transact-SQL reserved keywords.

member.summary: Gets the Transact-SQL statement that defines the database data definition language (DDL) trigger.
member.returns: A value that specifies the actual text of the Transact-SQL statement that defines the database DDL trigger.

member.summary: Updates any object property changes on the instance of SQL Server.

member.summary: Updates any object property changes on the instance of Microsoft SQL Server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the object and retrieves properties when the object is next accessed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.SetSnapshotIsolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the snapshot isolation level.
member.param: A value that specifies whether the snapshot isolation level is enabled.If True, the snapshot isolation level is enabled.If False, the snapshot isolation level is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiNullDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active.If True, user-defined data types default to allowing NULL values.If False (default), user-defined data types default to not allowing NULL values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiNullsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active. If True, comparisons to null values equate to false.If False (default), comparisons to null values equate to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiPaddingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active.If True, trailing blanks inserted into variable-length columns are not trimmed.If False (default), blanks inserted into variable-length columns are trimmed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiWarningsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active.If True, warnings are issued when null values are encountered in a statement.If False (default), warnings are not issued when null values are encountered in statements.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.ArithmeticAbortEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active.If True, a transaction is stopped and rolled back when an arithmetic error occurs.If False (default), a transaction continues when an arithmetic error occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active.If True, the database is closed, and its resources are freed when no user connection accesses the database.If False (default), the server maintains the database in an open and ready state regardless of user activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoCreateStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOCREATESTATISTICS database option is active.
member.returns: value that specifies whether the AUTOCREATESTATISTICS database option is active.If True, statistics are automatically created.If False (default), statistics are not automatically created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active. If True, the database is automatically reduced.If False (default), statistics are not automatically reduced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoUpdateStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICS database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICS database option is active.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoUpdateStatisticsAsync
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.BrokerEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.CloseCursorsOnCommitEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active.If True, the cursor is closed when a transaction commits.If False (default), the cursor is not closed when a transaction commits.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.ConcatenateNullYieldsNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active.If True, the concatenated result is NULL.If False (default), the value is concatenated with a zero string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.DatabaseOwnershipChaining
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the database ownership chaining is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the database ownership chaining is active.If True, database ownership chaining is active.If False (default), database ownership chaining is not active.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.DateCorrelationOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the date correlation optimization is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the date correlation optimization is active.If True, date correlation optimization is active.If False (default), date correlation optimization is not active.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.IsParameterizationForced
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether parameterization is forced on the database.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether parameterization is forced on the database.If True, parameterization is forced.If False (default), parameterization is not forced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.LocalCursorsDefault
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether the local server cursors are used by default.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether local cursors are used by default.If True, local cursors are used.If False (default), local cursors are not used and the cursors are implemented at the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.MirroringRedoQueueMaxSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the redo queue of the mirror server instance in KB.
member.returns: An Integer value that specifies maximum size of the redo queue of the mirror server instance in KB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.MirroringTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time, in seconds, that the principal server instance waits for a PING message from another instance in the mirroring session before assuming the other instance is disconnected.
member.returns: An Integer value that specifies the mirroring time-out period, in seconds, on the principal server instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.NumericRoundAbortEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the NUMERIC_ROUNDABORT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether there is a loss of precision due to rounding in an expression causes an error.If True, an error is generated and no results are returned.If False (default), a warning is generated and a NULL is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.PageVerify
member.summary: Specifies the type of page integrity check that Microsoft SQL Server performs when reading database pages.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the type of page integrity check performed when SQL Server reads database pages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.Parent
member.summary: Gets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that owns the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.Properties

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.Alter
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of the database, except ownership, and create, alter, or drop any child objects.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.AlterAnyApplicationRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY APPLICATION ROLE permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of any application role in the database, except ownership.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY APPLICATION ROLE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.AlterAnyAssembly
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY ASSEMBLY permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of any assembly in the database, except ownership.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY ASSEMBLY permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.AlterAnyAsymmetricKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY ASYMMETRIC KEY permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of any asymmetric key in the database, except ownership.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY ASYMMETRIC KEY permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.AlterAnyCertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY CERTIFICATE permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of any in the certificate in the database, except ownership.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY CERTIFICATE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabasePermissionSet.AlterAnyContract
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY CONTRACT permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee change the properties of any Service Broker contract in the database, except ownership.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER ANY CONTRACT permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole
member.summary: The object represents a SQL Server database security role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A object value that specifies the database on which to create the role.
A value that specifies the name of the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.AddMember(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an existing database user or database role to the database role.
member.param: A value that specifies the database user or role to be added to the referenced role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Alter
member.summary: Updates any object property changes on the instance of Microsoft SQL Server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Create
member.summary: Creates a database role on the instance of Microsoft SQL Server as defined by the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Deny(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String)
member.summary: Denies the specified set of permissions for the specified grantee on the database role.
member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied the specified set of permissions on the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Deny(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Denies the specified set of permissions for the specified grantees on the database role.
member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied the specified set of permissions on the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Deny(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Denies the specified set of permissions for the specified grantee and other users that the grantee granted the specified set of permissions on the database role.
member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied the specified set of permissions on the database role.

A property that specifies whether users, to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission, are also denied access to the specified set of permissions on the database role.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted the specified set of permissions are all denied the specified set of permissions.If False, only the grantee is denied the specified set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Deny(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Denies the specified set of permissions for the specified grantees and other users that the grantee granted the specified set of permissions on the database role.
member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied the specified set of permissions.

A property that specifies whether users, to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission, are also denied access to the specified set of permissions on the database role.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted the specified set of permissions are all denied the specified set of permissions.If False, only the grantee is denied the specified set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Drop
member.summary: Drops the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.DropMember(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified database user or role from the referenced database role.
member.param: A value that specifies the database user or role to be removed from the referenced database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.EnumAgentProxyAccounts
member.summary: Returns a list of agent proxy accounts that are assigned to the database role.
member.returns: A system object value that contains information about the agent proxy accounts that are assigned to the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.EnumMembers
member.summary: Returns a list of database users that are members of the database role.
member.returns: A system object value that contains information about the members of the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.EnumObjectPermissions
member.summary: Returns a list of object permissions assigned to the referenced database role.
member.returns: An array of object values that contain information about object permissions assigned to the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DependencyWalker.DiscoverDependencies(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlSmoObject[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a hierarchical object tree that represents the parent or child dependent relationships for a specified object array of SQL Server objects on the instance of SQL Server.
member.returns: A object that specifies the hierarchical SQL Server object tree.
member.param: A object array value that specifies the SQL Server objects for which to discover the dependent relationships.

A value that specifies whether to find parent objects on which the objects in the array are dependent or the child objects that are dependent on the objects in the array. If True, the method will look for the parent objects for each object in the specified array. If False, the method will look for the child objects for each object in the specified array.

member.summary: Updates the extended property on the instance of Microsoft SQL Server with any property changes that have been made to the object that it represents.

member.summary: Creates an extended property on the instance of Microsoft SQL Server as defined by the object.

member.summary: Drops the extended property that is represented by the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ExtendedProperty.MarkForDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks the object so that it will be dropped the next time the method is called for its parent object.
member.param: A Boolean value that specifies whether the object and the extended property it represents are dropped when the method is run on the parent object or not.If True, the extended property is dropped when the method is run on the parent object. If False, the extended property is not dropped when the method is run on the parent object.

member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied the specified set of permissions on the extended stored procedure.

A property that specifies whether users, to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission, are also denied access to the specified set of permissions on the extended stored procedure.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted the specified set of permissions are all denied the specified set of permissions.If False, only the grantee is denied the specified set of permissions.

member.returns: An value that specifies the ID value that uniquely identifies the foreign key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.IsChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the foreign key constraint was enabled without checking existing rows.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the foreign key constraint was enabled without checking existing rows.If True, the foreign key constraint was enabled without checking existing rows.If False (default), all rows were checked when the foreign key constraint was enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the foreign key is enabled.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the foreign key is enabled.If True, the foreign key is enabled.If False (default), the foreign key is not enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.IsSystemNamed
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the foreign key is named by the system or by the user.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the foreign key is named by the system or the user.If True, the foreign key is named by the system.If False (default), the foreign key is named by the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.NotForReplication
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the foreign key is available for replication.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the foreign key is available for replication.If True, the foreign key is not available for publishing by replication services.If False (default), the foreign key is available for publishing by replication services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that is the parent of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.ReferencedKey
member.summary: Gets the primary key referenced by the foreign key.
member.returns: A value that specifies the primary key referenced by the foreign key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.ReferencedTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the table that contains the primary key referenced by the foreign key.
member.returns: A value that specifies the referenced table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.ReferencedTableSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the table schema that contains the primary key referenced by the foreign key.
member.returns: A value that specifies the referenced table schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.ScriptReferencedTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies whether to script the table referenced by the foreign key.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to script the table referenced by the foreign key.If True, the table referenced in the foreign key is included in scripting operations.If False (default), no attempt is made to include the table referenced by the foreign key in scripting operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.ScriptReferencedTableSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies whether to script the schema of the table referenced by the foreign key.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to script the schema of table referenced by the foreign key.If True, the schema of the table referenced in the foreign key is included in scripting operations.If False (default), no attempt is made to include the schema of the table referenced by the foreign key in scripting operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ForeignKey.UpdateAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the foreign key supports cascading updates.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the foreign key supports cascading updates.If True, all rows containing the foreign key are also updated when you attempt to update a row with a key that is referenced by the foreign key.If False (default), the foreign key is not updated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption
member.summary: The enumeration is a list of constant values that specify the levels of detail of collected fragmentation information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Detailed
member.summary: Value = 3. Calculates statistics based on 100% of the data. This option is available starting with SQL Server 2005.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Fast
member.summary: Value = 1. Calculates statistics based on parent level pages only. This option is available starting with SQL Server 2000.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Sampled
member.summary: Value = 2. Calculates statistics based on samples of data. This option is available starting with SQL Server 2005.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions
member.summary: Interface with properties that expose database options.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AnsiNullDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active.If True, user-defined data types default to allowing NULL values.If False (default), user-defined data types default to not allowing NULL values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AnsiNullsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active. If True, comparisons to null values equate to false.If False (default), comparisons to null values equate to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AnsiPaddingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active.If True, trailing blanks inserted into variable-length columns are not trimmed.If False (default), blanks inserted into variable-length columns are trimmed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AnsiWarningsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active.If True, warnings are issued when null values are encountered in a statement.If False (default), warnings are not issued when null values are encountered in statements.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.ArithmeticAbortEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active.If True, a transaction is stopped and rolled back when an arithmetic error occurs.If False (default), a transaction continues when an arithmetic error occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AutoClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active.If True, the database is closed, and its resources are freed when no user connection accesses the database.If False (default), the server maintains the database in an open and ready state regardless of user activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AutoShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active. If True, the database is automatically reduced.If False (default), statistics are not automatically reduced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.AutoUpdateStatisticsAsync
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.BrokerEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.CloseCursorsOnCommitEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active.If True, the cursor is closed when a transaction commits.If False (default), the cursor is not closed when a transaction commits.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.ConcatenateNullYieldsNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active.If True, the concatenated result is NULL.If False (default), the value is concatenated with a zero string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.DateCorrelationOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the date correlation optimization is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the date correlation optimization is active.If True, date correlation optimization is active.If False (default), date correlation optimization is not active.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.IsParameterizationForced
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether parameterization is forced on the database.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether parameterization is forced on the database.If True, parameterization is forced.If False (default), parameterization is not forced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.LocalCursorsDefault
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether the local server cursors are used by default.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether local cursors are used by default.If True, local cursors are used.If False (default), local cursors are not used and the cursors are implemented at the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.MirroringTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time, in seconds, that the principal server instance waits for a PING message from another instance in the mirroring session before assuming the other instance is disconnected.
member.returns: An Integer value that specifies the mirroring time-out period, in seconds, on the principal server instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.NumericRoundAbortEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the NUMERIC_ROUNDABORT database option is active.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether there is a loss of precision due to rounding in an expression causes an error.If True, an error is generated and no results are returned.If False (default), a warning is generated and a NULL is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.PageVerify
member.summary: Specifies the type of page integrity check that SQL Server performs when it reads database pages.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the type of page integrity check performed when SQL Server reads database pages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.QuotedIdentifiersEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether identifiers delimited by double quotation marks (" ") are Transact-SQL reserved keywords or contain characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether identifiers delimited by double quotation marks are Transact-SQL reserved keywords or contain characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.If True, identifiers delimited by double quotation marks are interpreted as object identifiers.If False, identifiers delimited by double quotation marks are strings that contain characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules, such as apostrophes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the database is read-only.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the database is read-only.If True, the database is read-only.If False (default), the database can be updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.RecoveryModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the recovery model for the database.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the recovery model that is currently in operation on the database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IDatabaseOptions.RecursiveTriggersEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies whether recursive triggers are enabled on the database.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether recursive triggers are enabled on the database.If True, recursive triggers are enabled.If False (default), recursive triggers are not enabled.

member.summary: Denies access to the specified permission for the specified grantee and other users that the grantee granted access on the SMO object.

A value that specifies the grantee to be denied access to the permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grants access to the specified permission and the ability to grant access to other users for the specified grantee on the SMO object.

A value that specifies the grantee to be denied access to the permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants access to the specified permission and the ability to grant access to other users for the specified grantee on the SMO object.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A value that specifies a grantee to be denied access to the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant access to the object for other users.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant other users access to the SMO object.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant other users access to the SMO object.
A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting access to the SMO object to other users. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants access to the specified permission and the ability to grant access to other users for the specified grantee on the SMO object under an assumed role.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied access to the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant access to the object for other users.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant other users access to the SMO object.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant other users access to the SMO object.
A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting access to the SMO object to other users. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Revoke(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String)
member.summary: Revokes previously granted permissions from a grantee on the SMO object.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A value that specifies a grantee to be revoked access to the permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Revoke(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Revokes previously granted permissions from a list of grantees on the SMO object.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be revoked access to the permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Revoke(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Revokes previously granted permissions from a grantees on the SMO object and any other users to whom the grantees have granted access. The grantees are also given the ability to revoke other users' access.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be revoked access to the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to revoke access from the object for other users.If True, the grantee is given the ability to revoke other users' access from the SMO object.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to revoke other users' access from the SMO object.

A property that specifies whether users that the grantee has granted access to the permission are also revoked access from the permission.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted access to the permission are all revoked access from the permission.If False, only the grantee is revoked access from the permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.IObjectPermission.Revoke(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Revokes previously granted permissions from a grantee on the SMO object and any other users to whom the grantee has granted access. The grantee is also given the ability to revoke other users' access under an assumed role.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.
A value that specifies a grantee to be revoked access to the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to revoke access from the object for other users.If True, the grantee is given the ability to revoke other users' access from the SMO object.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to revoke other users' access from the SMO object.

A property that specifies whether users that the grantee has granted access to the permission are also revoked access from the permission.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted access to the permission are all revoked access from the permission.If False, only the grantee is revoked access from the permission.
A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when revoking access from the SMO object for other users. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.EnumColumns
member.summary: Enumerates a list of columns that can be accessed on the linked server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of tables that can be accessed on the linked server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionCOLUMN_SIZEThe number of significant digits in the column. The return value for the PRECISION column is in base 10.BUFFER_LENGTHThe transfer size of the data to and from the column.DECIMAL_DIGITSThe number of digits to the right of the decimal point.NUM_PREC_RADIXThe base for numeric data types.NULLABLEThe nullability of the column. 1 = NULL is possible. 0 = NOT NULL.REMARKSThis field always returns NULL.COLUMN_DEFThe default value of the column.SQL_DATA_TYPEThe value of the SQL data type as it appears in the TYPE field of the descriptor. This column is the same as the DATA_TYPE column, except for the DateTime and ISO interval data types. This column always returns a value.SQL_DATETIMEE_SUBThe subtype code for DateTime and ISO interval data types. For other data types, this column returns NULL.CHAR_OCTET_LENGTHThe maximum length in bytes of a character or integer data type column. For all other data types, this column returns NULL.ORDINAL_POSITIONThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.IS_NULLABLEThe nullability of the column in the table. ISO rules are followed to determine nullability. An ISO SQL-compliant DBMS cannot return an empty string.YES = Column can include NULLS. NO = Column cannot include NULLS.This column returns a zero-length string if nullability is unknown.The value returned for this column is different from the value returned for the NULLABLE column.SS_DATA_TYPEThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.EnumTables
member.summary: Enumerates a list of tables that are available on the linked server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of tables that can be accessed on the linked server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionTABLE_CATThe table qualifier name. Various DBMS products support three-part naming for tables (qualifier.owner.name). In SQL Server, this column represents the database name. In some other products, it represents the server name of the database environment of the table. This field can be NULL.TABLE_SCHEMThe owner of the table in the linked server. In SQL Server, this column represents the name of the database user who created the table. This field always returns a value.TABLE_NAMEThe name of the table in the linked server. This field always returns a value.TABLE_TYPEThe type of table: table, system table, or view.REMARKS SQL Server does not return a value for this column.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.EnumTables(System.String)

In SQL Server, this column represents the database name. In some other products, it represents the server name of the database environment of the table. This field can be NULL.TABLE_SCHEMThe owner of the table in the linked server. In SQL Server, this column represents the name of the database user who created the table. This field always returns a value.TABLE_NAMEThe name of the table in the linked server. This field always returns a value.TABLE_TYPEThe type of table; table, system table, or view.REMARKS SQL Server does not return a value for this column.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.Catalog

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.CollationCompatible
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the default collation of the linked server is compatible with the default collation on the local instance of SQL Server.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the remote linked server is compatible with the collation on the local instance of SQL Server. If True, the linked server has a default collation that is compatible with the default collation on the local instance of SQL Server.If False (default), the linked server has a default collation that is incompatible with the default collation on the local instance of SQL Server. This means that data compared on the two servers may return unexpected results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.CollationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the collation to use when sorting data from the linked server.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the collation to use when sorting data from the linked server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to wait for a connection to be established with the linked server before timing out.
member.returns: An value that specifies the time (in seconds) the local server attempts to connect to the remote server before timing out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Alter
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee change properties, except ownership, of the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Connect
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the CONNECT permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee create a connection between the object and an instance of SQL Server.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the CONNECT permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Control
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the CONTROL permission in the permission set. The permission gives the grantee full control over the object, including all defined permissions for the object, the ability to create permissions on the object, and full control over child objects.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the CONTROL permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Delete
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the DELETE permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee delete the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the DELETE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Execute
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the EXECUTE permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee execute the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the EXECUTE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Impersonate
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the IMPERSONATE permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee impersonate the user or the login.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the IMPERSONATE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Insert
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the INSERT permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee insert data into the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the Insert permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Receive
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the RECEIVE permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee receive messages from a Service Broker queue.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the RECEIVE permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.References
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the REFERENCES permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee reference data in the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the REFERENCES permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Select
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the SELECT permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee retrieve data from the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the SELECT permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Send
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the SEND permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee send messages to a Service Broker service.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the SEND permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the TAKE OWNERSHIP permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee take ownership of the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the TAKE OWNERSHIP permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.AllowInProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.If True, the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.If False (default), the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an external process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.Description
member.summary: Gets a textual description of the OLE DB provider.
member.returns: A value that contains a textual description of the OLE DB provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.DisallowAdHocAccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether SQL Server allows ad hoc access to data by using OPENROWSET and OPENDATASOURCE functions with the OLE DB provider.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether SQL Server allows ad hoc functions with the OLE DB provider.If True, ad hoc functions are not allowed.If False (default), ad hoc function are allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.DynamicParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the provider allows '?' parameter marker syntax for parameterized queries.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether SQL Server allows parameterized queries with the OLE DB provider.If True, parameterized queries are allowed.If False (default), parameterized queries are not allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.IndexAsAccessPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.If True, the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.If False (default), the SQL Server indexes are used to fetch data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.LevelZeroOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether all OLE DB providers are supported or just those that are compliant with the level 0 OLE DB interface.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether all OLE DB providers are supported or just those that are compliant with the level 0 OLE DB interface.If True, only level 0 OLE DB providers are allowed.If False (default), all levels of OLE DB provider are allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.NestedQueries
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider allows nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider allows nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause.If True, nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause of a SELECT statement are allowed.If False (default), nested SELECT statements are not allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.NonTransactedUpdates
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether data updates with the OLE DB provider are logged and are recoverable.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether data updates with the OLE DB provider are logged and are recoverable.If True, data updates are not logged on the OLE DB provider and cannot be recovered.If False (default), data updates are logged on the OLE DB provider and can be recovered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the type of repair mode used by the database consistency check (DBCC) functions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairType.AllowDataLoss
member.summary: Tries to repair all reported errors. These repairs can cause some data loss.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairType.Fast
member.summary: Maintains syntax for backward compatibility only. No repair is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairType.None
member.summary: No repair is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairType.Rebuild
member.summary: Performs repairs that have no possibility of data loss. This can include quick repairs, such as repairing missing rows in non-clustered indexes, and more time-consuming repairs, such as rebuilding an index. REPAIR does not repair errors involving FILESTREAM data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumProcesses
member.summary: Enumerates a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description UrnThe URN string that represents the process. "Server[@Name='PCNAME']/Process[@Spid='51']", for example.NameThe name of the process.SpidThe SQL Server process ID that uniquely identifies the process, see sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).LoginThe login running the process.HostThe name of the computer on which the process is running.StatusThe status of the process. Running and sleeping, for example.CommandThe command currently being executed.DatabaseThe database is which the process is running.CpuThe cumulative time taken by the process in seconds. See sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).MemUsageThe number of pages in the procedure cache that are currently allocated to the process. A negative number indicates that the process is freeing up memory allocated by another process.BlockingSpidThe SQL Server procedure ID of the procedure that is blocking the referenced procedure..IsSystemThe value that specifies whether the process is a system process or not.ProgramThe name of the program the process ExecutionContextIDThe ID value that uniquely identifies the execution context under which the process is running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumProcesses(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server with the option to exclude system processes.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description UrnThe URN string that represents the process. "Server[@Name='PCNAME']/Process[@Spid='51']", for example.NameThe name of the process.SpidThe SQL Server process ID that uniquely identifies the process, see sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).LoginThe login running the process.HostThe name of the computer on which the process is running.StatusThe status of the process. Running and sleeping, for example.CommandThe command currently being executed.DatabaseThe database is which the process is running.CpuThe cumulative time taken by the process in seconds. See sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).MemUsageThe number of pages in the procedure cache that are currently allocated to the process. A negative number indicates that the process is freeing up memory allocated by another process.BlockingSpidThe SQL Server procedure ID of the procedure that is blocking the referenced procedure..IsSystemThe value that specifies whether the process is a system process or not.ProgramThe name of the program the process ExecutionContextIDThe ID value that uniquely identifies the execution context under which the process is running.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to include system processes in the results.If True, system processes are excluded.If False, system processes are included.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory
member.summary: The object provides programmatic access to the Active Directory functionality.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.Register
member.summary: Creates a registration entry for the instance of Microsoft SQL Server in the Active Directory service as defined by the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.Register(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a registration entry for the instance of SQL Server in the Active Directory service as defined by the object with the option to register all the databases on the instance of SQL Server.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to register all the databases in the Active Directory service.If True, all the databases are registered with the instance of SQL Server.If False, the databases are not registered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.Unregister
member.summary: Removes the registration entry for the instance of SQL Server from the Active Directory service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.UpdateRegistration
member.summary: Updates any changes to the instance of SQL Server on the Active Directory service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the Active Directory service is available.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the Active Directory service is available.If True, the Active Directory service is available.If False (default), the Active Directory service is unavailable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.IsRegistered
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the instance of Microsoft SQL Server is registered in the Active Directory service as a Service Control Point (SCP).
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the instance of SQL Server is registered in the Active Directory service.If True, the instance of SQL Server is registered in the Active Directory service.If False (default), the instance of SQL Server is not registered in the Active Directory service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerActiveDirectory.Parent
member.summary: Gets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that is the parent of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.AnsiNullsStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether ISO NULL handling is enabled in the data definition language (DDL) trigger.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether ISO NULL handling is enabled in the DDL trigger. ISO NULL handling requires that any comparison to a NULL value equates to a NULL value.If True, ISO NULL handling is enabled and comparisons to null values equates to False.If False (default), ISO NULL handling is disabled and comparisons to null values equates to True.

A value that specifies the associated password for the account that was used to open the service master key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.Default
member.summary: Data in pages located at the end of a file is moved to pages earlier in the file. Files are truncated to reflect allocated space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.EmptyFile
member.summary: Migrates all of the data from the referenced file to other files in the same filegroup. (and objects only).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.NoTruncate
member.summary: Data in pages located at the end of a file is moved to pages earlier in the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.TruncateOnly
member.summary: Data distribution is not affected. Files are truncated to reflect allocated space, recovering free space at the end of any file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers
member.summary: Enumerates a list of available instances of SQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of local available instances of SQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.
member.param: A value that specifies whether local instances are listed or all instances available on the network.If True, only local instances are listed.If False, all instances are listed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers(System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of available instances of SQL Server that are installed on the computer with the specified instance name.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server on the specified computer.If a single instance of SQL Server is specified in the name parameter, instead of a computer name, results are returned for the specified instance only. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the computer on which the instances of SQL Server are installed or a single instance of SQL Server.

member.summary: A 64-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Binary
member.summary: A fixed-length byte array ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Bit
member.summary: An unsigned bit value that can be 0, 1, or a null reference.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Char
member.summary: A fixed-length byte array of non-Unicode (256 code page) characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Date
member.summary: Date object represents any valid Gregorian calendar date between '0001-01-01' CE and '9999-12-31' CE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.DateTime
member.summary: A system object value that specifies a date and time between January 1, 1753 and December 31, 9999 to an accuracy of 3.33 milliseconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.DateTime2
member.summary: DateTime2 is considered an extension of the existing DATETIME object with a large date range and large default fractional precision. Values that represent any valid Gregorian calendar date between ‘0001-01-01’ CE and ‘9999-12-31’ CE combined with any valid time of day based on a 24-hour clock.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: DateTimeOffset returns valid Gregorian calendar date between `0001-01-01’ and ‘9999-12-31’ with any valid time of day based on a 24 hour format between ’00:00:00’ and max ’23:59:49.9999999’. Included in the DateTimeOffset is a time zone offset that must be between ‘-14:00’ and ‘+14:00’.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Decimal
member.summary: A fixed precision and fixed scale numeric value between -1038 -1 and +1038 -1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Float
member.summary: An 8-byte floating point number within the range of -1.79E +308 through 1.79E +308.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Geography
member.summary: Geography spatial type represents data in a round-earth coordinate system. The SQL Server geography data type stores ellipsoidal (round-earth) data, such as GPS latitude and longitude coordinates..

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SqlDataType.Geometry
member.summary: Geography spatial type represents data in a Euclidean (flat) coordinate system.

member.summary: A variable-length byte array ranging from 0 to 231 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) bytes.

member.summary: A 32-bit signed integer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the ways in which statistical information is collected from tables or views during the creation or update of a statistic counter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Default
member.summary: Value = 5. Specifies that a percentage of the table or indexed view is used when collecting statistics. The actual percentage is calculated by the SQL Server engine automatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.FullScan
member.summary: Value = 3. Specifies that all rows in the table or view are read when gathering statistics. This option must be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Percent
member.summary: Value = 1. Specifies that a percentage of the table or indexed view is used when collecting statistics. This options cannot be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table. When specified, use the sampleValue argument to indicate number of rows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Resample
member.summary: Value = 4. Specifies that the percentage ratio of the table or indexed view used when collecting statistics is inherited from existing the statistics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Rows
member.summary: Value = 2. Specifies that a number of rows in the table or indexed view are used when collecting statistics. This option cannot be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table. When specified, use the sampleValue argument to indicate number of rows.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the type of statistic that is targeted for the update operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.All
member.summary: Value = 3. Statistical information is collected for columns and indexes. This option is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.Column
member.summary: Value = 1. Statistical information is collected for columns only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.Index
member.summary: Value = 2. Statistical information is collected for indexes only.
